description:
It sounds like a very low-level component that should not concern users at all - excepts turbo nerds of course.

Crashes a lot, double quotes stop working. A regular user has no chance to know that he needs to restart this app. Super serious issue as it renders the system unusable. This app should be watched and be restarted when it crashes. The naive assumption that something just runs and never crashes is... well, very naive.
summary: How a non-nerd supposed to know why he needs it?

description:
If you need to quickly switch back and forth between multiple alphabets like Chinese or Arabic, this will basically get the job done. But it's inferior to what you may be used to if you're a windows user.
The keyboard shortcuts dont seem to work globally, they certainly don't work if you already have a text box selected. you have to drag your mouse all the way over to the system tray icon to change languages most of the time. it also doesn't seem capable of working without keeping a window open.
I also agree with the other user that this needs a better description because I wouldn't have known I needed it if it wasn't for some help forums.

No matter what I do this program takes it upon itself to startup and show itself in the notification panel. Despite the fact that it is not set to start automatically, and the icon is set to be hidden.
